Job Title: Grader Sorter I

Location: Greenwood Village, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Overview

The Grader/Sorter I position is responsible for the accurately and concisely receiving of both natural and lab grown stones from outside manufacturers, as well as customer trades and outside sales.

The pay range for this role is $21-25 per hour.

Responsibilities

 Comply and ensure accuracy on all material testing procedures assigned.  Maintain excellent records immediately notifying supervisors of any documentation or SAP discrepancies during all steps of processing.  Ensure accuracy within areas of responsibility before distributing to other areas. Work with supervisor to resolve any issues.  Data entry both in SAP and Microsoft office applications.  Assist in the physical inventory count and reconciliation research when requested.  Keep supervisor informed as to what is happening within areas of your responsibility.  Additional duties as assigned.  May also be responsible for: Test stones to protect inventory integrity.  Sort, validate and or grade loose stones according to company standards.  Package and label merchandise for sale following established rules.  Using equipment to capture data and or images for use in the selling process.  Sieving and or gauging stones to separate by sizes.  Balance back vendor paperwork to system reports before sending to accounting.  Cross train between team groups of Serialized, Components, and Service Orders 
Qualifications

 Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines.  Possess excellent manual dexterity with small items.  Demonstrated ability to see and discern very minor details both to the naked eye and with the aid of magnification.  Demonstrated attention to detail and accuracy.  Intermediate skills with Outlook, Excel and Word preferred, but not mandatory.  Demonstrated ability with math. Adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing  Understanding and ability to work with decimal numbers, fractions, and percentages.  Ability to convert fractions, decimals, and percentages.  Experience with SAP preferred, but not mandatory. 
 Behavioral Characteristics 

Focused; can concentrate on the task at hand for sustained periods. Consistently and patiently thorough. Works at a consistent pace in an environment that can sometimes be very fast paced. Comfortable with familiar processes and environments. Follows well-established plans. Attentive to, careful and accurate with the details involved in a job. Detail-oriented. A reliable team member who enjoys work of a high quality. Works autonomously in their area of expertise.

 Work Environment 

The primary environment for this role is an open workspace which is brightly lit, subdued with regard to bright color and decoration, and relatively free of clutter. Considerable business is conducted using the telephone and computer technology. Work requires dexterity with small objects, visual acuity, and ability to discern color gradations. Travel may be required to stores, conferences or events up to 5% of the time.

 Why Work for Shane Co.? 

Benefits

Joining #TeamShaneCo comes with a host of benefits designed to support you and your loved ones- we understand a supportive benefits package is key to a fulfilling work experience. As a family-owned business, we prioritize your well-being, recognizing that our success is a collective effort. Here's what we offer:

Compensation and Recognition: we operate on a team-based model; no commission sales! We offer a competitive base rate, engaging SPIFs, and monthly opportunities for team performance bonuses.

Time off: You’ll enjoy a generous time-off package, including 3 weeks of vacation, and an annual float day. We value holidays and are closed on major ones. Plus, you receive a float day and paid volunteer day annually. We also value your work-life balance and keep favorable hours that provide a great retail experience to our customers while respecting your time and well-being.

Family-centric benefits: We care about your family, and our benefits extend beyond standard offerings. In times of major illness, you can earn time off at full pay for self or family care. You’ll also benefit from paid parental leave, an Employee Assistance Program, and assistance navigating medical complexities.

Health and wellness: We value your health and provide you with paid sick time. Additionally, you can access competitive medical, dental, and vision plans, a 401(k) with company match, and flexible spending accounts. You can also enjoy voluntary benefits, including long-term disability, life insurance for dependents, and pet insurance. We also have a dedicated staff member who focuses on well-being and work-life balance, ensuring you thrive professionally and personally.

Employee Discount: Enjoy a generous store and online discount, available for you and your family members.

Shane Co. serves our customers with an unparalleled standard of excellence. Our people get to share in our customers’ milestone moments such as weddings, birthdays, anniversaries, and everything in between.

Our goal for you is to give you an employment experience like no other so you wake up and want to come to work every day! If you love being part of a team as well as providing personal attention to every customer, this is the place for you!

The pay range for this role is $21-25 per hour. The range describes the minimum to maximum likely rate for this job description in the state of Colorado. Individual pay will be determined based on skills and qualifications for the role. The salary range for this same position may be lower or higher in markets outside of Colorado.

Employer will not sponsor visa or work authorization.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
